text: Oof that is a lot of change at once Eric! Sounds like you have a lot of great ways for folks to connect.

elements.text: Oof that is a lot of change at once Eric! Sounds like you have a lot of great ways for folks to connect.

text:
<@U011E0VHPA4>, I’ve seen good things happen when you gather all your info in one place, consolidate it, then schedule time with each SME (45 min). Record it. 

Spend the first 15 showing them what you have and correcting it, then interview them more generally about their subject matter expertise. 

Over time you gave correct info AND priceless recorded interviews you (and your subcontracted team) can refer to. Then you can shift into maintenance mode and check in with SMEs for special projects or a once a year refresh.

The most important thing is to not ask for vague regular meetings or too much time from your SMEs. Emphasize how careful you’ll be with their time and how much you’ll leverage the info they give you.

elements.text:

Over time you gave correct info AND priceless recorded interviews you (and your subcontracted team) can refer to. Then you can shift into maintenance mode and check in with SMEs for special projects or a once a year refresh.

The most important thing is to not ask for vague regular meetings or too much time from your SMEs. Emphasize how careful you’ll be with their time and how much you’ll leverage the info they give you.
